name: Leg Raises, Lying
how_to_perform:
1. Lie on your back with your arms extended overhead and your legs straight.

2. Keep your lower back pressed into the ground as you engage your core muscles to stabilize your body.

3. Lift both of your legs off the ground, keeping them straight, until they are at a 90-degree angle to your body.

4. Slowly raise one leg higher than the other, keeping it straight, and hold for a brief moment.

5. Lower your raised leg back down slowly and repeat with the other leg.

6. Continue alternating legs, raising each leg high above the other, focusing on controlled movements and core engagement throughout the exercise.
short_summary: Leg raises are an isolation exercise that targets the abs muscles when performed in a lying position.
